abstract.text: An
object implements the appearance and behavior of a horizontal button divided into multiple segments. This class is used in conjunction with the
class to implement a segmented control.

inlineContent.text: to customize the attributes of a segmented control. To customize the appearance of individual segments, you can also subclass and override the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
An active area inside a control.
An
object implements the appearance and behavior of a horizontal button divided into multiple segments. This class is used in conjunction with the
class to implement a segmented control.
Draws the image and label of the segment in the specified view.
Returns the image associated with the specified segment.
Returns the image scaling mode associated with the specified segment.
Returns the interior background style for the specified segment.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified segment is enabled.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified segment is selected,
Returns the label of the specified segment.
Selects the next segment.
Selects the previous segment.
Returns the menu for the specified segment.
The number of segments in the segmented control.
The visual style used to display the segmented control.
Selects the segment with the specified tag.
The index of the selected segment of the control, or
if no segment is selected.
Sets the enabled state of the specified segment
Sets the image for the specified segment.
Sets the image scaling mode for the specified segment.
Sets the label for the specified segment.
Sets the menu for the specified segment.
Sets the selection state of the specified segment.
Sets the tag for the specified segment.
Sets the tooltip for the specified segment.
Sets the width of the specified segment.
Returns the tag of the specified segment.
Returns the tooltip of the specified segment.
The tracking mode used for the segments of the control.
Returns the width of the specified segment.
Display one or more buttons in a single horizontal group.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
